Package ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager

Class BooleanNoZoneSubscribeCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager.BooleanNoZoneSubscribeCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VehicleSignalCallback

    public abstract class BooleanNoZoneSubscribeCallback
extends java.lang.Object
implements VehicleSignalCallback
    A callback class pertaining to subscription of vehicle control signal values of the boolean type and with no specific zones.

    When calling an advanced method on a vehicle control signal, you must create a BooleanNoZoneSubscribeCallback instance as an input parameter if the signal value is of the boolean type and involves no specific zone. This class provides two callback methods:

    • onChangeBooleanSignal: called when the Vehicle System Adapter (VSA) layer normally returns a vehicle control signal value of the boolean type and with no specific zone. This callback passes you the signal value.
    • onErrorBooleanSignal: called when the VSA layer fails to return a vehicle control signal value of the boolean type and with no specific zone. This callback passes you the error for you to determine how to handle it.
    Since:
    5
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.VehicleControl

    • Method Detail

      • onChangeBooleanSignal

        public abstract void onChangeBooleanSignal​(boolean value)
        Called when the VSA layer normally returns a vehicle control signal value that is of the boolean type and involves no specific zone.

        You must implement this callback for your application to perform a specific operation when the signal value changes.

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the new signal value from the VSA layer.
        Since:
        5

      • onErrorBooleanSignal

        public abstract void onErrorBooleanSignal​()
        Called when the VSA layer fails to return a vehicle control signal value that is of the boolean type and involves no specific zone.

        This callback is invoked to pass you the error for you to determine how to handle it.

        Since:
        5

      • onChangeSignal

        public final void onChangeSignal​(PropertyInfo propertyInfo)
        Description copied from interface: VehicleSignalCallback
        Called when any subscribed vehicle signal property has changed.

        For example, if the vehicle speed signal property is subscribed to at an interval of 500 ms, this callback is called every 500 ms to notify the user of any vehicle speed change.

        Specified by:
        onChangeSignal in interface VehicleSignalCallback
        Parameters:
        propertyInfo - Indicates the vehicle property information.

      • onErrorSignal

        public final void onErrorSignal​(java.lang.String propId,
                                int zoneId,
                                int errorCode)
        Description copied from interface: VehicleSignalCallback
        Called when an error occurs during subscription to a specified vehicle signal property.

        You can determine the subsequent operations based on the status code.

        Specified by:
        onErrorSignal in interface VehicleSignalCallback
        Parameters:
        propId - Indicates the vehicle signal property ID.
        zoneId - Indicates the vehicle zone (default value: entire vehicle). The values are defined in VehicleZone.
        errorCode - Indicates the status code, which can be ZVSHW_MANAGER_ERROR::ZVSHW_MANAGER_OK for an operation success, INVALID_ARGUMENT_ERR for a parameter error, or ZVSHW_MANAGER_ERROR::ZVSHW_MANAGER_ERR for other errors.
